observations.title: Insufficient Access Controls
observations.description: Administrative functions are accessible to non-admin users without proper authorization checks.
observations.evidence: During testing, regular user account 'testuser' was able to access the /admin panel and view sensitive configuration settings.
observations.impact: Unauthorized users could modify critical system settings, potentially leading to data breaches or system compromise.
observations.recommendation: Implement role-based access control (RBAC) for all administrative functions. Ensure proper authorization checks are in place before granting access to sensitive areas.

observations.title: Weak Password Policy
observations.description: The system allows users to set weak passwords without complexity requirements.
observations.evidence: Successfully created account with password '123456'. No minimum length, complexity, or dictionary check enforced.
observations.impact: Weak passwords are susceptible to brute force attacks, potentially allowing unauthorized access to user accounts.
observations.recommendation: Implement strong password policy requiring minimum 12 characters, uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters. Consider implementing password strength meter and blocking common passwords.

observations.title: Missing Security Headers
observations.description: Web application does not implement recommended security headers.
observations.evidence: HTTP response analysis shows missing Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options, and Strict-Transport-Security headers.
observations.impact: Missing security headers increase vulnerability to XSS attacks, clickjacking, and man-in-the-middle attacks.
observations.recommendation: Implement recommended security headers: - Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self' - X-Frame-Options: DENY - Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000 - X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
references: CWE-1021: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers

observations.title: Outdated Dependencies
observations.description: Application uses outdated third-party libraries with known vulnerabilities.
observations.evidence: Package.json shows jQuery 2.1.4 (current: 3.6+), lodash 4.17.15 (current: 4.17.21+). Both versions have published CVEs.
observations.impact: Known vulnerabilities in dependencies could be exploited by attackers to compromise the application.
observations.recommendation: Update all dependencies to latest stable versions. Implement automated dependency scanning in CI/CD pipeline. Consider using tools like npm audit or Snyk.
references: OWASP A06:2021 - Vulnerable and Outdated Components

observations.title: Information Disclosure in Error Messages
observations.description: Detailed error messages expose sensitive system information.
observations.evidence: SQL error messages reveal database table structure and query details. Stack traces show internal file paths and framework versions.
observations.impact: Information disclosure aids attackers in reconnaissance and vulnerability exploitation.
observations.recommendation: Implement generic error messages for end users. Log detailed errors server-side only. Configure production environment to suppress debug information.
references: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through Error Messages
